info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 6:41PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ..SPOTTY FREEZING RAIN OR FREEZING DRIZZLE POSSIBLE EARLY TO MID SUNDAY MORNING... Some light freezing rain may occur across the southern Adirondacks, and northwest of Glens Falls and Saratoga Springs in Warren and Saratoga Counties, where some sub freezing air may be trapped at the surface. Portions of northern Fulton County, especially north of the I-90 may also have a brief period of freezing rain. 4 to 8 am is when the spotty freezing rain may occur. Temperatures will be rising from the mid 20s and lower 30s to above freezing thereafter. Some slick spots may occur on untreated surfaces. Motorists should drive with extra caution in the early to mid morning hours.
